event.doc_name: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: 2025-04-02 | COMPLAINT For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief against All Defendants Filing fee: $ 405, receipt number AMADC-10928559 (Fee Status: Filing Fee paid), filed by American Public Health Association, Ibis Reproductive Health, United Auto Workers, Brittany Charlton, Katie Edwards, Peter Lurie, Nicole Maphis.

Founded in 1872, Plaintiff American Public Health Association (“APHA”) represents about 50,000 people through organizational and individual memberships and has more than 23,000 individual public health professional members. APHA acts to build capacity in the public health community and champions optimal, equitable health and well-being for all.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: American Public Health Association (50,000 members, public health advocacy organization representing researchers)

evidence.text: Founded in 2002, Plaintiff Ibis Reproductive Health (“Ibis”) is a global research organization that drives change through bold, rigorous research and principled partnerships that advance sexual and reproductive autonomy, choice, and health worldwide.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Ibis Reproductive Health (global research organization focused on sexual and reproductive health, including transgender and gender diverse populations)

evidence.text: The International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace and Agricultural Implement Workers of America (“UAW”) is one of the largest and most diverse unions in North America, with members in the United States, Canada and Puerto Rico and in virtually every sector of the economy. ... Tens of thousands of UAW members rely on NIH grant funding for their jobs and training.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers (UAW) (large union representing 1,000,000+ members, including researchers and staff at universities)

evidence.text: Plaintiff Dr. Brittany Charlton is an Associate Professor at Harvard Medical School and Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health. She is a resident of Massachusetts and the Founding Director of the LGBTQ Health Center of Excellence...
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Brittany Charlton (Associate Professor at Harvard Medical School, Founding Director of LGBTQ Health Center of Excellence)

evidence.text: Plaintiff Dr. Katie Edwards is a professor at the University of Michigan School of Social Work. Dr. Edwards’ research focuses on preventing sexual and related forms of violence among minority communities...
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Katie Edwards (Professor at University of Michigan School of Social Work, focuses on violence prevention among minority communities)

evidence.text: Plaintiff Dr. Peter Lurie is an experienced research physician and the President and Executive Director of the Center for Science in the Public Interest, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in Washington, D.C.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Peter Lurie (Research physician, President and Executive Director of Center for Science in the Public Interest)

evidence.text: Plaintiff Dr. Nicole Maphis is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of New Mexico’s School of Medicine. Her research explores how alcohol usage affects the risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiff: Nicole Maphis (Postdoctoral fellow at University of New Mexico, focuses on alcohol usage and Alzheimer's disease)

evidence.text: Defendant the National Institutes of Health (“NIH”) is an agency of the United States, established pursuant to 42 U.S.C. § 281, and is housed within the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: National Institutes of Health (NIH, agency within U.S. Department of Health and Human Services)

evidence.text: Defendant Jay Bhattacharya is Director of NIH and is sued in his official capacity.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Jay Bhattacharya (Director of NIH, sued in official capacity)

evidence.text: Defendant the United States Department of Health and Human Services (“HHS”) is an agency of the United States that houses NIH.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: United States Department of Health and Human Services (HHS, agency housing NIH)

evidence.text: Defendant Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. is the Secretary of HHS and is sued in his official capacity.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. (Secretary of HHS, sued in official capacity)

evidence.text: Plaintiffs are individual researchers and organizations whose members are researchers who have secured (or are in the process of securing) funding from NIH.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
